purpleculture_pinyin:
tuó
hump or hunchbacked; camel
горбатый или горбатый; верблюд
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 驼)
Pictophonetic: 它 indicates the sound; 馬 (horse) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
駝背 [ tuó bèi ]: hunchbacked; stooping; hunchback
駝色 [ tuó sè ]: light tan (color); camel-hair color
駝子 [ tuó zi ]: hunchback
駝鹿 [ tuó lù ]: elk; moose
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 馬 [ mǎ ] horse; surname
    • 它 [ tā ] it; other
heisig_chinese_memo: It's not a horse, but Saudi's use camel (back end) for transportation the same way cowboys use horses.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the snake (它) on the back of the horse (馬) is its hump
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: From afar it might look like a horse, but when it comes closer you see the humps and realize it's a camel (back end).
humanum_full_description_en:
From " horse " to " it " sound. " Camel " means camel. Although there is no " camel " in Shuowen, the "Shanhaijing" already has "camel", that is, camel. "Shan Hai Jing. "The classics of the Beishan Mountains have more beasts on camels", Guo Pu's note: "There are meat saddles, good deeds in the quicksand, travel 300 miles a day, and the weight of a thousand catties, knows where the water spring is." The word " camel " alone can also mean a camel. "Jade articles. Horse Department: "Camel, camel." Examples in ancient books such as "Qi Min Yao Shu. "Boiled glue": "Sand cowhide, buffalo cowhide, pigskin are the top, donkey, horse, camel, and mule skins are the second." Zhang Ji of the Tang Dynasty "Guan Shanyue": "The rivers and waters are connected to the ground and the grass is flat, and the wild camels look for moraine. Zhongming."

" Camel " also refers to a person's back curved like a hump. For example, in the Yuan Dynasty, Sa Dula's "Picture of People in the Four Times Palace": "A woman with a shallow step waist and a half camel, a small fan flutters at the moth among the flowers." Zhu Xun and other "Puji Fang. Diseases Three": "However, those who have deep beriberi, slumped back, and hand-foot spasm, take the two drugs mentioned in the preceding paragraph. Although they cannot eliminate the root cause, they can still avoid swelling and pain."

" Camel " also means the use of livestock. "Zhengzitong. Horse Department: "A camel is called a camel by an animal." For example, in Dong Jieyuan's "Xiangong Tune" Volume 6: "Quickly ask about the severity of sorrow, and the camel on a horse will not move." Later, it also means that people are carrying heavy objects. , Such as Feng Menglong's "Yu Shiming Yan. "Shi Hongzhao Dragon, Tiger, Monarch and Minister Meeting": "Tomorrow, Shi Hongzhao will hold the plate, and Guo Dalang will come to the front of Mrs. Chai's act."
humanum_full_description:
從「馬」，「它」聲。「駝」表示駱駝。《說文》雖然沒有「駝」，但《山海經》已有「橐駝」，即駱駝。《山海經．北山經》「其獸多橐駝」，郭璞注：「有肉鞍，善行流沙中，日行三百里，其負千斤，知水泉所在也。」單獨的「駝」字也可以表示駱駝。《玉篇．馬部》：「駝，駱駝。」古書中的例子如《齊民要術．煮膠》：「沙牛皮、水牛皮、豬皮為上，驢、馬、駝、騾皮為次。」唐代張籍〈關山月〉：「溪水連地霜草平，野駝尋水磧中鳴。」

　　「駝」又指人的背部彎曲如駝峰。如元代薩都剌〈題四時宮人圖〉：「一女淺步腰半駝，小扇輕撲花間蛾。」明代朱橚等《普濟方．諸病三》：「但腳氣年深，背駝腰曲，手足攣拳者，服前項二藥，雖未能卒去病根，然亦能免大腫痛。」

　　「駝」還表示用牲畜負物。《正字通．馬部》：「駝，凡以畜負物曰駝。」如董解元《西廂記諸宮調》卷六：「休問離愁輕重，向個馬兒上駝也駝不動。」後也表示人背負重物，如馮夢龍《喻世明言．史弘肇龍虎君臣會》：「明日，史弘肇頂着盤子，郭大郎駝着架子，走來柴夫人幕次前。」
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
駝 (Simplified: 驼)
Pinyin: tuó
English Definition: hump or hunchbacked; camel
Total strokes: 15; Radical: 馬
Pictophonetic: 它 indicates the sound; 馬 (horse) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:

    • 馬 [ mǎ ] horse; surname
    • 它 [ tā ] it; other
Example Words:
駝背 [ tuó bèi ]: hunchbacked; stooping; hunchback
駝色 [ tuó sè ]: light tan (color); camel-hair color
駝子 [ tuó zi ]: hunchback
駝鹿 [ tuó lù ]: elk; moose

從「 馬 」，「 它 」聲。「 駝 」表示駱駝。《說文》雖然沒有「 駝 」，但《山海經》已有「橐駝」，即駱駝。《山海經．北山經》「其獸多橐駝」，郭璞注：「有肉鞍，善行流沙中，日行三百里，其負千斤，知水泉所在也。」單獨的「 駝 」字也可以表示駱駝。《玉篇．馬部》：「駝，駱駝。」古書中的例子如《齊民要術．煮膠》：「沙牛皮、水牛皮、豬皮為上，驢、馬、駝、騾皮為次。」唐代張籍〈關山月〉：「溪水連地霜草平，野駝尋水磧中鳴。」 「 駝 」又指人的背部彎曲如駝峰。如元代薩都剌〈題四時宮人圖〉：「一女淺步腰半駝，小扇輕撲花間蛾。」明代朱橚等《普濟方．諸病三》：「但腳氣年深，背駝腰曲，手足攣拳者，服前項二藥，雖未能卒去病根，然亦能免大腫痛。」 「 駝 」還表示用牲畜負物。《正字通．馬部》：「駝，凡以畜負物曰駝。」如董解元《西廂記諸宮調》卷六：「休問離愁輕重，向個馬兒上駝也駝不動。」後也表示人背負重物，如馮夢龍《喻世明言．史弘肇龍虎君臣會》：「明日，史弘肇頂着盤子，郭大郎駝着架子，走來柴夫人幕次前。」

駝字的基本解释

駝
tuó
见“驼”。

駝字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tuó］
［《廣韻》徒河切，平歌，定。］
“驼1”的繁体字。亦作“馳2”。亦作“駞1”。
(1)骆驼。
(2)脊背弯曲如驼峰。
(3)通“馱”。背负；驮负。
(4)引申为负债，欠帐。
(5)通“坨”。成块的东西。
(6)方言。取物。
(7)量词。相当于坨、块。
[②]［chí］
同“馳1”。

駝字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【馬字部】　駝； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1437第04
【廣韻】徒何切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】唐何切，?音陀。【玉篇】駱駝也。一作馲駝。【前漢·西域傳】鄯善國多馲駝。【註】師古曰：脊上肉鞍，隆高若封上，俗呼封牛。或曰駝狀似馬，頭似羊，長項，垂耳，有蒼褐黃紫數色，性耐寒惡熱，夏至退毛至盡。人欲載，輒屈足受之。自燉煌往外國，流沙千餘里，無水，有伏流，駝遇其處，停不進，以足跑地，掘之，常得水。又靑海北，夏有?風，傷行旅，風將至，駝先引頸鳴，以鼻口匿沙中，人見之，則以氊擁蔽口面，避其患，其臥腹不帖地，屈足，糞煙直上如狼煙。亦名橐駝。【古諺】少所見，多所怪，見橐駝，以爲馬腫背。又【唐制】驛置有明駝使，非邊塞軍機，不得擅發。俗本改明作鳴，非。　又通作它。【揚雄·長楊賦】敺橐它。　又背僂也。【柳宗元·郭橐駝種樹傳註】人背駝不能仰也。或作他。【莊子·德充符】衞有惡人哀駘它。【註】它與駝同，言背僂也。　又凡以畜負物曰駝。或作佗。【前漢·趙充國傳】以一馬自佗負。別作駞。【李白詩】吳姬十五細馬駞。

駝字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
駝字的起名意思

暂无。

camel
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tuó］
["Guangyun" Tu Heqi, Ping Ge, Ding. ]
The traditional characters of "驼1". Also known as "Chi 2". Also known as "駞1".
(1) Camel.
(2) The back is curved like a hump.
(3) Through "tuo". Carry on one's back
(4) Explained to be debts, debts in arrears.
(5) Through "tuo". Things in chunks.
(6) Dialects. Fetch.
(7) Quantifiers. It is equivalent to tuo and block.
[②]［chí］
Same as "Chi 1".
camel
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Haiji 1】【horse character department】　 camel; Kangxi strokes: 15; page number: page 1437 04
[Guang Yun] Disciple He Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Tang He Qi,? Yin Tuo. [Jade articles] camels too. A llama. [Pre-Han · Western Regions Biography] Shanshan has many camels. [Note] Shigu said: The meat saddle on the spine, if the long high is sealed, it is commonly called the bull. Or the camel looks like a horse, the head looks like a sheep, a long neck, lop-eared, pale brown, yellow, purple and several colors. It is resistant to cold and heat, and the hair fades to the end of the summer solstice. People want to be loaded, but no matter how bad they are. From Xiehuang to a foreign country, there is more than a thousand li of quicksand, no water, there is a low current, the camel meets it, and can't stop, run with its feet, dig it, and often get water. In the north of the sea, there is wind in the summer, hurting the traveling, and the wind is approaching. The camel will scream in the neck first, hide in the sand with the nose and mouth, and when people see it, they will cover their mouth and face, avoid their troubles, and lie down on the ground. , Bent the feet, the dung smoke straight up like wolf smoke. Also known as a camel. [Ancient proverb] Seeing less, but more strange. Seeing a camel, you think that a horse has a swollen back. Also [Tang Dynasty] The post has a camel ambassador, not a frontier military plane, and it is not allowed to send it without permission. The common version is changed to Ming as Ming, not.　Through it again. [Yang Xiong·Chang Yang Fu] Drive it away.　Back again. [Notes on Liu Zongyuan·Guo Li's Camel Planting Tree] People can’t look back on their backs. Or be him. [Zhuangzi·De Chong Fu] Wei You wicked people mourn it. [Note] It's the same as the camel, but it's back.　Everything is called a camel by the animal's burden. Or as Tuo. [Previous Han·Zhao Chongguo Biography] Lose yourself with one horse. Don't be a chariot. 【Li Bai Poems】Wu Ji's fifteen thin horses. camel
